name: 5f544c2f-e8a6-43df-b0eb-d794e410e4cc
displayName: How to see the claim's import file

text.text: How can I access the import file for an incomplete imported claim in ZOLL Billing?

text: To access the import file for an incomplete imported claim in ZOLL Billing, you can click the claim number on the import file line to view the incomplete claim. You can also click the "Attachments" link on the Incomplete Claim page to view the attachments.

text.text: What steps should I follow to view the readable NEMSIS file associated with an incomplete imported claim?

text: To view the readable NEMSIS file associated with an incomplete imported claim, you can click the NEMSIS (readable) link on the "Incident details" tab when you create the claim or on the Claim page when you work the claim.

text.text: Can you guide me on finding the import file for a claim in suspended status in ZOLL Billing?

text: To find the import file for a claim in suspended status in ZOLL Billing, you can view all incomplete claims on the Dashboard. You can identify the file by its file name, import date or PCR number. You can also click the "Attachments" link on the Incomplete Claim page to view the attachments.

text.text: Where can I locate the import file attachment on the Claim page for a claim in suspended status?

text: To find the import file attachment on the Claim page for a claim in suspended status, you can view all incomplete claims on the Dashboard. You can identify the file by its file name, import date or PCR number. You can also click the "Attachments" link on the Incomplete Claim page to view the attachments.

text.text: Is there a specific tab I should click on the Claim page to access the import file attachment?

text: To view the attachments, you can click the "Attachments" link on the Incomplete Claim page. The attachment opens in another tab so if it contains information that you need to work the claim, leave it open on another monitor for reference.

text.text: How do I navigate to the Attachments tab on the Claim page to view the import file?

text: To view the import file, you can click the "Attachments" tab on the Claim page. The attached file name displays as a link under "Filename". Click the blue name of the file to download to your PC.

text.text: Can you explain how to find the import file for a claim on the Imported Claims page in ZOLL Billing?

text: To view the import file for a claim on the Imported Claims page in ZOLL Billing, you can view all incomplete claims on the Dashboard. You can identify the file by its file name, import date or PCR number. You can also click the "Pick claims" link and then pick the date of the import.

text.text: What options are available to identify the import file on the Imported Claims page?

text: You can identify the import file by its file name, import date or PCR number. You can also click the claim number in the "Claim #" column.

text.text: How do I recognize the import file among other entries on the Imported Claims page?

text: You can identify the import file by its file name, import date or PCR number. You can also click the claim number in the "Claim #" column.

text.text: What information can I use to locate the import file for a specific claim on the Imported Claims page?

text: You can identify the import file by its file name, import date or PCR number. You can also click the claim number in the "Claim #" column.

text.text: Can you provide a summary of the steps to follow to view the import file for a claim in ZOLL Billing?

text: To view the import file for a claim in ZOLL Billing, you can view all incomplete claims on the Dashboard. You can identify the file by its file name, import date or PCR number. You can also click the "Attachments" link on the Incomplete Claim page to view the attachments.

text.text: Are there any specific indicators to help identify the import file among other attachments on the Claim page?

text: You can identify the import file by its file name, import date, or PCR number.

text.text: How often are import files accessible for incomplete and suspended claims in ZOLL Billing?

text: Imported claims are assigned a status of incomplete with a status reason of. You can view the NEMSIS file in a readable format and add/view notes and attachments.

text.text: Is there any difference in accessing the import file for claims in different statuses within ZOLL Billing?

text: Imported claims are assigned a status of incomplete with a status reason of. You can view the NEMSIS file in a readable format and add/view notes and attachments.
